title: Manchester United fans vent frustration over team announcements being cut short before kick-off
title_page: Manchester United fans vent frustration over team announcements being cut short before kick-off | Daily Mail Online
text:
Manchester United supporters have had plenty to complain about in recent weeks and their latest gripe is team announcements not being completed before kick-off.
Fans have been left perplexed this season with the reading out of Louis van Gaal's starting XI and the naming of the substitutes being cut short due to the action starting.
United reveal the away team's starters and substitutes first ahead of any kick-off at the Theatre of Dreams. Van Gaal's line-up then comes second in a bid to rouse the crowd.
Manchester United fans have written to the club asking for the pre-kick-off schedule to be changed
Manchester United stadium announcer Alan Keegan (right) interviews Rory McIlroy in August 2014
Pre-match music and entertainment lingers on so much, however, that a portion of the United 18 cannot be broadcast on a regular basis, beaten by the referee's first whistle.
It has led to some fans writing in to United to ask why the schedule cannot be switched.
The club could make a move to completely forgo announcing the away team or read out United's first.
Van Gaal is presiding over the club's worst ever Premier League campaign.
And the Dutchman said on Thursday he could see out the remainder of his three-year contract thanks to boardroom backing.
'Everybody knows I have signed a three-year contract,' said Van Gaal.
Manager Louis van Gaal expects to see out the remainder of the three-year contract he signed 18 months ago
'It's a process, not one game, and I want to continue until the end. If I wasn't willing to do that, I don't think I would have started here. I am always fighting.
'Of course I'm very happy with the support of Ed Woodward and the Glazers. But when the board has such confidence in you, the pressure is higher than when they say it is your last game. Then your confidence is not so high and you can fight against it. And when you fight you have a bigger motivation than when they support you.
